 In The Obamians, acclaimed author James Mann tells the compelling story of the administrationÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s struggle to enact a coherent and effective set of policies in a time of global turmoil. At the heart of this struggle are the generational conflicts between the Democratic establishmentÃ¢â‚¬â€including Robert Gates, Hillary Clinton, and Joseph BidenÃ¢â‚¬â€and Obama and his inner circle of largely unknown, remarkably youthful advisers, who came of age after the Cold War had ended.
